result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton J. Hancock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Amount to be determined within 60 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton J. Hancock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Proceedings.  Plea and Sentencing Hearing held March 31, 2016

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Colton J. Hancock in court & in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CF55 & 15CF69  @ 10:34 am. State gives plea agreement 15CF69 Plea to ct 8, remaining ct's DRI for Restitution, 6 years prison,  3 year initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision  Conditions to extended supervision Restitution to be determined in 60 day days, counseling,  costs & 25 % prison wages applied, 15CF55 plea to ct 2, ct 1 DRI for restitution no information any due in this case, 3 years prison, 1 1/2 year initial confinement 1 1/2 year extended supervision, costs & counseling, Concurrent to each other & any other prison sentencing serving. Complied with victim rights.  Parties agree with plea agreements. Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights.  15CF69 Ct 8 Possession of Short-Barreled shot gun, no contest plea, 15CF55 Fleeing, no contest plea.  15CF69 Ct's 1-7 DRI for restitution & sentencing, 15CF55 Ct 1 DRI for restitution & sentencing. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understand elements.  15CF69 agrees PTAC in ct 8. Atty Abernethy-Mays is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  No additional factual basis. Court finds probable cause, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to ct 8 in 15CF69 & ct 2 Fleeing in 15CF55. State gives sentencing recommendation concurrent with Marinette, Marquette, Forest & Outagamie.  Abernethy-Mays gives sentencing recommendation. State replys. Def. makes statement.  State will provide other county case numbers. 
Court orders 15CF55 Ct 2 - 3 years prison, 1 1/2 initial confinement & 1 1/2 extended supervision, Concurrent with other sentences, costs, 250 DNA surcharge &  Sample & Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Restitution to be determined within 60 days. No credit for Langlade County case.  Def. is eligible for Earn Release Challenge Program. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. 
15CF69 Ct 8 - 6 years prison,  3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to with any other sentence & 15CF55 Conditions Restitution to be determined in 60 days, Counseling as deemed appropriate by agency & costs, 250 DNA Sample, 25% of prison wages to restitution & costs. Def. is eligible for Earn Release or Challenge Program. No credit for Langlade Co. Atty Def. advised of postconviction rights. Atty questions Substance Abuse program, Court finds is eligible for program. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
ad Prosequendum and Order To Institution

Defendant Colton J. Hancock in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Colton J. Hancock in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF55 and 15CF69 @ 9:18 a.m. Waiver of prelim filed and reviewed. Court accepts waiver and binds over. Informations filed, copies received, reading waived, not guilty pleas to cts 1 & 2 in 15CF55 and not guilty pleas to cts 1-8 in 15CF69. Court receives pleas and directs clerk to enter. Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record 9:25 a.m. Plea/Sent. 3/31/16 @ 10 a.m. New $5,000 signature bond signed - original never returned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF55 and 15CF69 @ 10:56 a.m. State advises on status, will need to writ defendant for waiver of prelim. Off the record for scheduling.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Colton J. Hancock in court, by telephone from Marquette Co. Jail with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF55 & 15CF69 @ 1:25 pm. Stae heard on bond, $5,000.00 Signature Bond. Atty Abernethy-Mays agrees with State & needs to talk to client. 15CF69 Atty appears special.  Atty has not objection to signaure bond.  Court orders $5,000.00 Signature bond, to cover both files. Def. has no problem waiving a p.h. time limits. Court explains to def. to reserve right for p.h. Def. agrees with Judge. Court accepts waiver of time limits & will reserve to have at a later date of p.h. Def. does not have to be in court for next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm. Court recalls @ 1:35 pm. Court vacates warrant.
